intro: Raoulia loganii, commonly known as the white raoulia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Raoulia loganii is often found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest understory.
